text: Do you have any general tips for implementing new special functions? I need to evaluate this integral: <https://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=int+1%2Fx+%281+-+x%29%5E%281%2Falpha%29+dx> on arbitrary intervals within about 1e-10 to 1 and while technically existing special functions (incomplete beta function or 2F1 hypergeometric function) can be used, their existing implementations (from GSL) don't handle this parameter range particularly well.

attachments.title: int 1/x (1 - x)^(1/alpha) dx - Wolfram|Alpha
attachments.text: Wolfram|Alpha brings expert-level knowledge and capabilities to the broadest possible range of people—spanning all professions and education levels.

elements.text: Do you have any general tips for implementing new special functions? I need to evaluate this integral:

on arbitrary intervals within about 1e-10 to 1 and while technically existing special functions (incomplete beta function or 2F1 hypergeometric function) can be used, their existing implementations (from GSL) don't handle this parameter range particularly well.

text: No, I didn't know that. It looks useful, thanks!

elements.text: No, I didn't know that. It looks useful, thanks!

text: There’s also <https://github.com/JuliaMath/HypergeometricFunctions.jl> which might be able to cope with that range.
